mr7 LOCAL mr7

NAME

mjo_r7_hash — hash a block of memory

SYNOPSIS

#include <mr7.h>

int
mjo_r7_hash(size_t * const o_hash, void * const i_block, size_t const i_octets);

DESCRIPTION

mjo_r7_hash() shall iterate through a block of memory (i_block) mixing bits to create a hash value.

Following is a description of the arguments.

o_hash
pointer to a ‘size_t’ that shall be set to the hash value
i_block
pointer to a fixed length block (in octets) of memory
i_octets
length (in octets) of the block of memory

If o_hash is nil, a hash value will not be constructed. Otherwise, *o_hash shall be set to the result.

If i_block is nil or i_octets is zero, *o_hash shall be set to zero (0).

If i_block is not nil, the routine shall iterate up until i_octets is consumed and place the result in *o_hash.

RETURN VALUES

If any of the arguments are invalid, the return code shall be MJO_FAIL and errno shall be set to EINVAL.

Upon success, the return code shall be MJO_OK.

NOTES

The hash algorithm used is based upon code from the sdbm library package authored by Ozan S. Yigit <http://www.cse.yorku.ca/~oz/hash.html>. The software written by Ozan is released to the Public Domain.

July 22, 2020 OpenBSD 7.0
